original_title: Lifting of Movement Restrictions at Vavuniya Prison
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The movement restrictions that were implemented within Vavuniya prison due to a measles infection scare will be lifted starting Monday (07).
According to Prisons Spokesman Chandana Ekanayake, inmates and officers will be able to resume their daily activities as usual from Tuesday (08).

The decision to impose movement restrictions was taken as a precautionary measure after an inmate and an officer at the Vavuniya prison tested positive for measles. To contain any potential spread of the infection, movement restrictions were in place for a period of two weeks.
